page.title: 02Farnborough
page.content: This small hamlet is situated on the {Berkshire Downs at an altitude of 220 {metres above sea level.}There are a variety of houses of different ages some council made of brick and tile, others tied cottages belonging to the two farms and some thatched cottages privately owned.The most notable house of the village is the{Old Rectory {dating from the mid 15th century and {made of red brick. { Manor Farm,}on maps known as Lower Farm,{sells home produced meat, {vegetables, poultry, and free range {eggs and some groceries.}There is no shop,post office or pub in the village. A van containing provisions calls weekly as does a fish and chip van. Milk is delivered every other day from a float. The{main places used for shopping are{Wantage and Newbury.
